title: Contributing to crvsreportpackage
text: new pull request created, subject peer review. review process follow guidelines set duck book. Reviewers follow series steps: Read understand ticket acceptance criteria. quick look GitHub pull request see changed. Update data code locally ensure testing right environment. Make sure branch. Run test suite ensure code conforms style guide. Run pipeline ensure functionality claims achieved. Throughout process reviewers write comments, using GitHub functionality usually good starting place. changes requested communication peers strongly encouraged. order standardise review process reviewers follow template bellow. ensure consistent feedback: merge approved, ticked closed relevant branch deleted. tech-debt associated ticket must spun-new tickets merge happens.
code: ##  Code review  #### Documentation  Any new code includes all the following forms of documentation:  - [ ] **Function Documentation** as docstrings within the function definition. - [ ] **Examples** demonstrating major functionality, which runs successfully locally.  #### Functionality  - [ ] **Installation**: Installation or build of the code succeeds. - [ ] **Functionality**: Any functional claims of new code have been confirmed. - [ ] **Automated tests**: Unit tests cover essential functions for a reasonable range   of inputs and conditions. All tests pass on your local machine. - [ ] **Packaging guidelines**: New code conforms to the project contribution   guidelines. ---  ### Review comments  *Insert detailed comments here!*  These might include, but not exclusively:  - bugs that need fixing (does it work as expected? and does it work with other code that it is likely to interact with?) - alternative methods (could it be written more efficiently or with more clarity?) - documentation improvements (does the documentation reflect how the code actually works?) - additional tests that should be implemented (do the tests effectively assure that it  works correctly?) - code style improvements (could the code be written more clearly?)  Your suggestions should be tailored to the code that you are reviewing. Be critical and clear, but not mean. Ask questions and set actions.

what: Convert character variable to a factor
title: Data cleaning
text: common practice read known values variable characters, hence stringsAsFactors = FALSE. However, read data may wish convert character variable factor.
code: # check data type class(bth_data$birth1g) #> [1] "character" # convert character variable to factor bth_data$birth1g <- as_factor(bth_data$birth1g) # check data type again class(bth_data$birth1g) #> [1] "factor"

title: Data cleaning
text: Sometimes order levels factor variable helpful. fct_relevel() function allows customise order levels.
code: # check the levels of the factor bth_data$birth1g |> levels() #> [1] "Twin"                 "Quadruplet or higher" "Triplet"              #> [4] "Single" # manually change the order of levels bth_data$birth1g |> fct_relevel("Single", "Twin", "Triplet", "Quadruplet or higher") |> levels() #> [1] "Single"               "Twin"                 "Triplet"              #> [4] "Quadruplet or higher"

title: Data cleaning
text: Sometimes values variable coded incorrectly. fct_recode() function enables change factor levels hand.
code: bth_data$birth3l <- as_factor(bth_data$birth3l) bth_data$birth3l |>  levels() #> [1] "RegionD" "RegionA" "RegionC" "RegionB" bth_data$birth3l |>  fct_recode("Lagos" = "RegionA", "Kano" = "RegionB") %>% levels() #> [1] "RegionD" "Lagos"   "RegionC" "Kano"

title: Data cleaning
text: Simple point polygon analysis can useful help identify region birth registered whether usual place residence urban rural. demonstrate load states Nigeria identify state National Bureau Statistics located . First load necessary packages. load 36 states Nigeria using vector boundary data supplied Natural Earth. Note can also retrieve state boundaries Nigeria (country) using rnaturalearth package. retrieve coordinates (lat,lon) NBS head office using geo() function geocoder package. ’ll convert sf object. Load nbs Next, ’ll plot results.  Finally, can use st_intersection() function sf package identify state NBS sits within.
code: library(tidygeocoder) # for retrieving coordinates for a location library(sf) # for handling spatial data states <- read_sf("data/nigeria.geojson") states <- ne_states(country = "nigeria", returnclass = "sf") nbs <- geo("1 Wole Olanipekun St, Abuja, Nigeria", method = "arcgis", full_results = FALSE) |>    st_as_sf(crs = 4326, coords = c("long", "lat")) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 7.500645 ymin: 9.061458 xmax: 7.500645 ymax: 9.061458 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   address                                         geometry #> * <chr>                                        <POINT [°]> #> 1 1 Wole Olanipekun St, Abuja, Nigeria (7.500645 9.061458) plot(states$geometry) plot(nbs$geometry, add = T, col = "red", pch = 16) st_intersection(nbs, states) |>    st_drop_geometry() # convert the results into a dataframe

title: Package for CRVS Report
text: want develop package, may want consider cloning repository following steps correct environment improve package. First, install crvsreportpackage GitHub, ensure package dependencies correctly managed installed using renv: 1.__Clone repository__: 2.__Initialize renv environment__: Upon first entering package directory, renv activate specific package environment defined crvsreportpackage. need run following R commands restore required packages: read renv.lock file contains dependencies install correct versions required packages. 3.__Install package__: environment set , can install package using: following steps, ensure necessary dependencies correct versions installed, allowing crvsreportpackage function intended. also mean can now open project develop package .
code: git clone https://github.com/tech-acs/crvsreportpackage.git cd crvsreportpackage install.packages("renv") renv::restore() devtools::install()

title: Package for CRVS Report
text: made significant changes package, might worth considering changing package version. can done DESCRIPTION file, bumping Version variable. order rebuild update crvsreportpackage making changes functions follow steps: steps package installed latest changes functions. mean package right state updated online repo. make big changes, double check unit test working expected, running manually:
code: # Remove the installed version of the package remove.packages("crvsreportpackage")  # Clear your R environment rm(list = ls())  # Restart R session (do this manually or with RStudio shortcut Ctrl+Shift+F10)  # Initialize renv if not already done if (!"renv" %in% installed.packages()) {   install.packages("renv") } library(renv)  # Restore the environment renv::restore()  # Update the lockfile renv::snapshot()  # Recreate documentation and rebuild the package library(devtools) document()  # Generates the NAMESPACE file and documentation using roxygen2 build()     # Builds the package install()   # Installs the package testthat::test_dir("tests/testthat")
